title: The unknown Serif
content:
I know its a no brainer, but I swear I don’t find this font.

Perhaps someone knows this one, or maybe a nicer one.

Thanks in advance.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081013104113im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/imagen375x175_4641.jpg)

 [‹ IF YOU DONT STAND... TEE SHIRT FONT ID](http://web.archive.org/web/20081013104113/http:/www.typophile.com/node/46294 "Go to previous forum topic") [60s AC Spark Plug Logo ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081013104113/http:/www.typophile.com/node/46280 "Go to next forum topic")
author: nolete

comments.content:
Wrongway by Joe Kraal is fairly close...  
 [http://www.testpilotcollective.com/paypal/wrongway.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20081013104113/http:/www.testpilotcollective.com/paypal/wrongway.html "http://www.testpilotcollective.com/paypal/wrongway.html")

My own New Global (my first commercial) is towards that direction as well  
 [http://www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000012](http://web.archive.org/web/20081013104113/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000012 "http://www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000012")

I wish I could be more helpful. I know I’ve seen this one before as well, but cant nail it down at the moment.
It looks to me like someone just went and added serifs to Trade Gothic?

Antiuser,

You sure got a point there, but still I think I’ve seen this as a typeface before.

Hi Nolete,  
It’s SerifedSans. No longer available (david carson font)  
See [http://www.typophile.com/node/31148](http://web.archive.org/web/20081013104113/http:/www.typophile.com/node/31148 "http://www.typophile.com/node/31148")

Jason,

Thanks for freshing up my mind ;-)
Ah, Carson. Yeah, that’s trade gothic with serifs added.

Hi guys, I really appreciate your help... and apologize for not being around to answer before.

I think the closest is Serifed, but unfortunately is no longer available, as Haildesign just mentioned.

Thanks y’all.
